oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Public speaking; Exhibitions; Souvenirs
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.); Thomas, J. W. (John Wilson), 1830-1906
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-page souvenir transcript of an address by J.W. Thomas, President of the Tennessee Centennial Exposition, delivered at the opening of the exposition on May 1, 1897. Thomas proclaimed that the event was to celebrate the state's past and present and inspire hope for the future. He also noted dollar amounts contributed to the affair by federal, state, and local governments. Thomas called on God to bless the exhibition.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition Collection, 1895-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Thomas was president of the Nashville, Chattanooga & St. Louis Railway.
